ObjectTypeField.description: Represents a field in a ProfileObjectType.

properties.name: ContentType
properties.description: The content type of the field. Used for determining equality when searching.

type.description: The content type of the field. Used for determining equality when searching.

properties.name: Source
properties.description: A field of a ProfileObject. For example: _source.FirstName, where "_source" is a ProfileObjectType of a Zendesk user and "FirstName" is a field in that ObjectType.

type.description: A field of a ProfileObject. For example: _source.FirstName, where "_source" is a ProfileObjectType of a Zendesk user and "FirstName" is a field in that ObjectType.

properties.name: Target
properties.description: The location of the data in the standard ProfileObject model. For example: _profile.Address.PostalCode.

type.description: The location of the data in the standard ProfileObject model. For example: _profile.Address.PostalCode.

ObjectTypeKey.description: An object that defines the Key element of a ProfileObject. A Key is a special element that can be used to search for a customer profile.

properties.name: FieldNames
properties.description: The reference for the key name of the fields map.

type.description: The reference for the key name of the fields map.

properties.name: StandardIdentifiers
properties.description: The types of keys that a ProfileObject can have. Each ProfileObject can have only 1 UNIQUE key but multiple PROFILE keys. PROFILE means that this key can be used to tie an object to a PROFILE. UNIQUE means that it can be used to uniquely identify an object. If a key a is marked as SECONDARY, it will be used to search for profiles after all other PROFILE keys have been searched. A LOOKUP_ONLY key is only used to match a profile but is not persisted to be used for searching of the profile. A NEW_ONLY key is only used if the profile does not already exist before the object is ingested, otherwise it is only used for matching objects to profiles.

type.description: The types of keys that a ProfileObject can have. Each ProfileObject can have only 1 UNIQUE key but multiple PROFILE keys. PROFILE means that this key can be used to tie an object to a PROFILE. UNIQUE means that it can be used to uniquely identify an object. If a key a is marked as SECONDARY, it will be used to search for profiles after all other PROFILE keys have been searched. A LOOKUP_ONLY key is only used to match a profile but is not persisted to be used for searching of the profile. A NEW_ONLY key is only used if the profile does not already exist before the object is ingested, otherwise it is only used for matching objects to profiles.

resource.description: An ObjectType resource of Amazon Connect Customer Profiles

properties.name: AllowProfileCreation
properties.description: Indicates whether a profile should be created when data is received.

type.description: Indicates whether a profile should be created when data is received.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Description of the profile object type.

type.description: Description of the profile object type.

properties.name: DomainName
properties.description: The unique name of the domain.

type.description: The unique name of the domain.

properties.name: ExpirationDays
properties.description: The default number of days until the data within the domain expires.

type.description: The default number of days until the data within the domain expires.

properties.name: Fields
properties.description: A list of the name and ObjectType field.

type.description: A list of the name and ObjectType field.

properties.name: Keys
properties.description: A list of unique keys that can be used to map data to the profile.

type.description: A list of unique keys that can be used to map data to the profile.

properties.name: ObjectTypeName
properties.description: The name of the profile object type.

type.description: The name of the profile object type.

properties.name: SourceLastUpdatedTimestampFormat
properties.description: The format of your sourceLastUpdatedTimestamp that was previously set up.

type.description: The format of your sourceLastUpdatedTimestamp that was previously set up.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: The tags (keys and values) associated with the integration.

type.description: The tags (keys and values) associated with the integration.

properties.name: TemplateId
properties.description: A unique identifier for the object template.

type.description: A unique identifier for the object template.

attributes.description: An ObjectType resource of Amazon Connect Customer Profiles

properties.name: CreatedAt
properties.description: The time of this integration got created.

type.description: The time of this integration got created.

properties.name: LastUpdatedAt
properties.description: The time of this integration got last updated at.

type.description: The time of this integration got last updated at.
